medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Chest pain began the night before admission, localized in the right pectoral area, worsening on deep inspiration and when seated. Prior to this, the patient experienced rhinorrhea and a nonproductive cough that resolved in 2 days but was accompanied by recurrent bouts of hematochezia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recurrent bouts of hip dislocation treated with bilateral imbrication of the hip capsules 15 months prior and bilateral external-rotation osteotomy for patellar subluxations. Positive antinuclear antibody tests. Previous rash believed to be erythema multiforme.
medical_history.family_history: Two older sisters had similar respiratory symptoms. Two grandparents had diabetes mellitus. No family history of autoimmune disease, inflammatory bowel disease, childhood cancer, or early death documented.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is an honors student in the 11th grade, plays soccer, and does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs.
